com.rolledback.framework

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rolledback.framework.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    The world class contains all information and objects concerning the actual tile/terrain of the Game class. The primary object of the World class is the Tiles matrix. This matrix can either be randomly generated via the buildMap function, or is loaded from a .map file, as passed in by the fileToLoad variable in the primary world constructor.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthew Rayermann (rolledback, www.github.com/rolledback, www.cs.utexas.edu/~mrayer)

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int w,
     int h,
     com.rolledback.teams.Team a,
     com.rolledback.teams.Team b,
     java.lang.String fileToLoad)
        Primary constructor. Called by the Game.java constructor
        Parameters:
        w - the width of the world (tiles)
        h - the height of the world (tiles)
        a - the first team of the game
        b - the second team of the game
        fileToLoad - if the user chose to load a map, this will be the file's name, empty string if not loading a file.

      • World

        public World()
        Dummy constructor. Used by the map editor. Only initializes the teams.

      • World

        public World(int w,
     int h,
     boolean rivers)
        Secondary dummy constructor. Also used by the map editor. Used to generate a random map.
        Parameters:
        w -
        h -
        rivers -

    • Method Detail

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        Prints out the map, with tiles represented by their mapChar variable.

      • printUnits

        public void printUnits()
        Prints out all the units on the map, uppercase letters belong to teamOne and lowercase belong to teamTwo.

      • printUnits

        public void printUnits(int x,
              int y)
        Prints out all the units on the map, uppercase letters belong to teamOne and lowercase belong to teamTwo. Also places an X at the given x, y location.

      • buildMap

        public boolean buildMap()
        Primary function fall for random map generation. First creates an initial set of basic terrain. Then a height map based on that terrain. After that rivers, factories, and cities are placed in that order.
        Returns:
        whether or not the map is considered valid, based on the result of a call to validMap

      • resetMap

        public void resetMap()
        Resets all variables changed in the buildMap function. This includes resetting the tiles and height map matrix, and clearing each team's factory list.

      • validMap

        public boolean validMap()
        Performs a breadth first search from the first non-river or non-mountain tile possible. Checks to make sure that all non-river & non-mountain tiles are then reachable from that tile. If all are not, then there the map is considered invalid.
        Returns:
        false if the map is not valid as defined by the method description.

      • initialTerrain

        public void initialTerrain()
        Randomly generates the initial terrain. Initial terrain being only plains, forests and mountains.

      • createHeightMap

        public void createHeightMap()
        Creates the height map for a given map. Mountains are given a height of 3, while all adjacent tiles are given a height of 2, and then those adjacent to those a height of 1. The height map is used in the river generation process.

      • generateRivers

        public void generateRivers()
        Top level function call for the generation of rivers. Controls max river length, minimum river length, and the minimum number of rivers needed.

      • generateRiver

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> generateRiver(int MLE)
        Generates a singular river. Called by the generateRivers function.
        Parameters:
        MLE - the max length estimate paramater. The river generated will have a max length in the range of MLE / 2 to MLE.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing the coordinates that make up the river. The tiles at these coordinate locations are not yet rivers though.

      • nextRiverSpot

        public Coordinate nextRiverSpot(int col,
                       int row,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> pathSoFar)
        Returns a random spot adjacent to the given row and col. The direction for the next spot is biased towards going to the left and downwards.
        Parameters:
        col - x location of the current river spot.
        row - y location of the current river spot.
        pathSoFar - the path of the river up until this point.
        Returns:
        the next spot in the path, if null is returned then none of the 4 adjacent spots were valid.

      • numRiverNextTo

        public int numRiverNextTo(int col,
                 int row,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> pathSoFar)
        Calculates the number of type river tiles next to the given spot.
        Parameters:
        col - the x location of the spot being inspected
        row - the y location of the spot being inspected
        pathSoFar - the path so far of the current river
        Returns:
        the number of type river tiles next to the spot

      • placeBridges

        public int placeBridges(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> path)
        Places bridges at random interior non-corner tiles on the river.
        Parameters:
        path - all the coordinates of the river.
        Returns:
        number of bridges placed on the river.

      • setRiverTileDirections

        public void setRiverTileDirections(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> riverPath)
        Determines what texture each spot in the river should have based on the relative locations of the next and previous river spots.
        Parameters:
        riverPath - the path of the river.

      • placeCities

        public void placeCities(int numCities,
               int min,
               int max)
        Randomly places cities on the map.
        Parameters:
        numCities - number of cities to place.
        min - the lowest numbered column the cities can be placed on.
        max - the highest numbered column the cities can be placed on.

      • placeFactories

        public void placeFactories(com.rolledback.teams.Team team,
                  int min,
                  int max)
        Randomly places factories belonging to the given team on the map, two per column.
        Parameters:
        min - the lowest numbered column the cities can be placed on.
        max - the highest numbered column the cities can be placed on.

      • mountainNextTo

        Counts the number of mountains next to the given spot.
        Parameters:
        col - the x location of the current spot.
        row - the y location of the current spot.
        Returns:
        the number of mountains next to the current spot.

        Parameters:

        maxCol - the highest numbered column the units can be placed on.
